Events.name: Dirty Bingo
Events.description: Join our fabulous hosts, famous drag queens Krystal Caring and Zelda Marshall for a naughty night in the Observatory! Bring your friends and get ready for the Dirty Bingo experience. Have some laughs and play for your chance to win “fun” prizes and toys!

Events.name: Comfortably Numb – Canada’s Pink Floyd Shown
Events.description: After a Sold Out Show in March 2016 at Algonquin Commons Theatre,  Ottawa’s own Comfortably Numb returns by Popular Demand!An Epic 3 Hour Concert… a must see show for die hard Pink Floyd fans!!..Please note, come hydrated and ready to immerse yourself into the world of Pink Floyd.

Events.location: SA Front Office E-114 Algonquin College(Woodroffe Campus)
Events.name: Tax Service 2017
Events.description: Starting the week of February 27, 2017 visit the SA Main Offie (E114) to set up an appointment.Our 30 minute appointments are only available on Tuesday and Thursdays. There is a $10 deposit when booking your appointment. No business or Quebec returns

Events.name: Neon Dreams & Darenots
Events.description: Halifax band Neon Dreams now shine brightly in the spotlight, rapidly writing one of the most compelling success stories by a fully independent Canadian act in quite some time. Their fresh take on electronic pop combines EDM with live instrumentation, and that is proving an irresistible combination.

Events.name: Hank Williams: The Lonesome Tour – Starring Jason Petty
Events.description: Direct from the historic stages of Nashville Tennessee comes “Hank Williams – The Lonesome Tour” starring Jason Petty in a show that will instantly transform you back to the early 1950’s when Hank Williams Senior was the biggest name in country music anywhere.

Events.name: Positive Space Workshop
Events.description: To learn more about the Positive Space Program consider participating in a 3 hour information session that will help you build on and apply practical skills and knowledge to counter homophobia, transphobia, and heterosexism in college settings.  The session provides and introduction to LGBTQ culture, covers common myths and terms, illustrates the important role of an ally, and gives you a chance to discuss case studies in an open, respectful environment.  These sessions will also provide you with resources and materials so that you can act as a Positive Space resource person.

Events.name: Poster Campaign
Events.description: The Annual Poster Campaign is designed to raise visibility, educate the public, and promote on-campus resources.

Events.name: LGBTQ Parade
Events.description: Algonquin's own LGBTQ parade. Students travel around campus in there own college wide LGBTQ parade. Communities come from all over the college to paricipate and through beads in the parade. Like a new Modern Mardi Graw

Events.name: LGBTQ Meet up
Events.description: Students meet up for the LGBTQ Montly meet up for students who are willing to gather information to meet up and talk.

Events.name: Day of Pink
Events.description: April 12, 2017 marks the International Day of Pink. It is a day where communities across the country, and across the world, can unite in celebrating diversity and raising awareness to stop homophobia, transphobia, transmisogyny, and all forms of bullying.

Events.name: Indigenous Craft Sale
Events.description: Come one come all. Indigenous craft for sale in the Student Commons. Come check out some of the craft made by your local Indigenous people

Events.name: Beading wiht Ashley
Events.description: Learn some the the indigenous traditional average ways. Beading with Ashley is a fun event that everyone will enjoy

Events.name: Indigenous Career Expo
Events.description: Meet with empolyers interested in hiring indigenous students

Events.location: Canadian Museum of History 100 Rue Laurier, Gatineau, Quebec.
Events.name: Indigenous Graduate Honouring Ceremony
Events.description: This event begins a procession of graduates who are led into grand hall with a grand entry song. This is followed with an opening prayer from First Nations, Inuit and Métis Elders. The program continues with special guests. Students are announced, in alphabetical order, with the name of their degree/diploma/certificate.  On stage they will each receive a special handmade gift given by the Elders on behalf of the community. A professional photographer will take your photo on stage. Once all students have been announced, an honour song is sung. Following this, the nominated student valedictorians will provide a speech followed by a guest who provides the congratulatory address. The ceremony concludes with a local Aboriginal performance. Guests then move into the lobby for a reception. The photographer will have a professionally lit photo area for you & your guests.  The event is free of charge.

Events.name: Moccasin Steps Clubs
Events.description: We take a walk indroors through the college.

Events.name: Bible Study Group
Events.description: This discussion group meets to study the word of God, strengthening faith and inspiring each other to live a Christian life. Everyone welcome. They also meet on Tuesdays from 2:30pm-3:30pm and 3:30pm-4:30pm.

Events.name: Jummah Paryer
Events.description: This congregational Muslim prayer is offered every Friday (until December 16) in the Spiritual Centre from 1:15pm-1:45pm. The Jummah prayer includes a sermon offered by a visiting khateeb to provide guidance in Islamic teachings. This event is open to all students and staff.

Events.name: Christian Prayer Group
Events.description: This open prayer time offers students and employees the opportunity to pray together, support each other, and share their Christian beliefs and traditions.

Events.name: Interfaith Spiritual Discussion Group
Events.description: This interfaith spiritual discussion group allows you to share and explore different aspects of spirituality. In this day and age, it is especially relevant and important to have a forum learn about other people’s world views and to be able to discuss spirituality in a peaceful and open environment.

Events.name: Meditation for Mental and Emotional Well-Being
Events.description: This workshop focuses on learning the core principles and techniques of meditation to enhance mental and emotional well-being. Participants will learn to better navigate emotional states and diminish overwhelming thoughts and anxiety through different forms of meditation, and breath and awareness practices.

Events.name: Smart Recovery
Events.description: Feel like you’re smoking too much pot? Worried about how much you drink? SMART Recovery® offers support to individuals who have chosen to change an addictive behaviour and lead a more satisfying life. The approach is science-based and works on motivation, urges, negative thinking, and a balanced lifestyle. These self-help meetings are confidential and interactive.

Events.name: Marijuana Meet up
Events.description: Meet up to discuss marijuana addition and the setups you can do to prevent this. Join others with the same problem to come togthere to concer your problem

Events.name: Cocaine Addiction Meet Up
Events.description: Meet up to discuss your cocaine addition and the setups you can do to prevent this. Join others with the same problem to come togthere to concer your problem

Events.description: Meet up to discuss your Molly addition and the setups you can do to prevent this. Join others with the same problem to come togthere to concer your problem.

Events.location: 290 Nepean St, Ottawa, ON K1R 5G3, Canada
Events.name: Focus Group by International Students Only
Events.description: Focus group to discuss things

Events.name: Canada in the WILD , Omega Park
Events.description: ncredible and FUN day trip to a unique place!Experience the forest, the mountain, the lake, the prairie and the boreal region and their furry inhabitants. See elk, bison, foxes, wolves, bears, moose, turkeys, racoons, coyote, reindeer and many many more.You get so close to these animals you can touch them and feed them! Take awesome photos while you do it!

Events.name: FUNtastic New York City
Events.description: 3 DAYS, 3 NIGHTS: This trip will take you to the Big Apple, the city that never sleeps, the pride of USA: NEW YORK CITY!

Events.name: Skate practice with trainer
Events.description: Want to learn how to skate? Ice skating lesson with Annika Dyck - certified skating trainer and a president of Algonquin Skating Club! Please bring your skates and warm clothing.Alert! The event depends on the weather condition! Please look for Annika at the ice rink. I will be there this time to ensure the group finds her

Events.name: International Cuisine Competition
Events.description: Participate in this International Cuisine Competition to win a $20, $30, or $50 giftcard to Rideau Centre! :D To participate, all you have to do is to cook a DELICIOUS cultural dish and bring them to this competition. Up to $20 refund can be made to each participants, so keep your receipts as proofs.All foodies are welcome to join us and have a taste of the various cuisines around the world

Events.name: Sexual Violence Prevention Week
Events.description: Sexual Violence Prevention Week is designed to raise awareness of Algonquin’s commitment to being a safe community that is free of sexual violence, and to provide students with the resources they need to address the warning signs of sexual violence they see in our community. Along with an eight-week social media campaign, this awareness and prevention week features events where students can get information and support in an engaging and accessible way. Help us build a culture of safety and consent here at Algonquin College by checking out these events and joining in the conversation on social media. Visit us on Facebook here and Twitter here.

Events.name: Confronting the Attitudes that Contribute to Sexual Harassment and Violence in Our Communities
Events.description: This event is free and open to all Algonquin students and employees who are interested in learning more about community-based initiatives for preventing sexual harassment and violence. This event will cover topics such as sexual consent, bystander intervention, toxic masculinity, and victim blaming. The presentation will be followed with a meet and greet session (with a free lunch) and information service fair highlighting the support services available to survivors of sexual violence at Algonquin College. Guest speakers include Julie S. Lalonde, an Ottawa-based feminist activist and women’s rights advocate, and Kevin Vowles, who delivers workshops, speeches, and training to empower men and boys to take a stand against violence against women and girls.

Events.name: Bringing in the Bystander Workshop
Events.description: This is an interactive workshop to help participants identify and prevent sexual violence. Open to all Algonquin students.

Events.name: Self-Defence Workshop
Events.description: This is an interactive workshop to help participants identify and prevent sexual violence. Open to all Algonquin students.

Events.description: Sexual assualt support. People come togethere to get Sexual assult support
